# List of Major League Baseball single-game runs batted in leaders

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

[![A man, wearing a baseball cap with a "T" in the center and a white baseball
uniform with the Toronto Maple Leafs baseball logo on the left breast, leans
forward
smiling.](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/70/Tony_Lazzeri_COTA_F1257_s1057_it3350_cropped.jpg/210px-
Tony_Lazzeri_COTA_F1257_s1057_it3350_cropped.jpg)](/wiki/File:Tony_Lazzeri_COTA_F1257_s1057_it3350_cropped.jpg)

[![A man, wearing a baseball cap with the Detroit Tigers' Old English "D" logo
in the center and a white baseball uniform with obscured lettering, faces
forward.](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a1/Rudy_York_1945.JPG/145px-
Rudy_York_1945.JPG)](/wiki/File:Rudy_York_1945.JPG)

[![A man in white pants, a dark blue baseball cap, and a dark blue baseball
jersey with "5" on the back leans on a baseball bat in his left
hand.](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e3/Nomar2002.jpg/107px-
Nomar2002.jpg)](/wiki/File:Nomar2002.jpg)

[Tony Lazzeri](/wiki/Tony_Lazzeri "Tony Lazzeri") _(left)_ , [Rudy
York](/wiki/Rudy_York "Rudy York") _(center)_ and [Nomar
Garciaparra](/wiki/Nomar_Garciaparra "Nomar Garciaparra") _(right)_ are the
only players to amass 10 runs batted in and [hit two grand
slams](/wiki/List_of_Major_League_Baseball_hitters_with_two_grand_slams_in_one_game
"List of Major League Baseball hitters with two grand slams in one game") in
the same game.

In [baseball](/wiki/Baseball "Baseball"), a [run batted
in](/wiki/Run_batted_in "Run batted in") (RBI) is awarded to a
[batter](/wiki/Batting_\(baseball\) "Batting \(baseball\)") for each
[runner](/wiki/Baserunning "Baserunning") who [scores](/wiki/Run_\(baseball\)
"Run \(baseball\)") as a result of the batter's action, including a
[hit](/wiki/Hit_\(baseball\) "Hit \(baseball\)"), [fielder's
choice](/wiki/Fielder%27s_choice "Fielder's choice"), [sacrifice
fly](/wiki/Sacrifice_fly "Sacrifice fly"), [sacrifice
bunt](/wiki/Sacrifice_bunt "Sacrifice bunt"), [catcher's
interference](/wiki/Catcher%27s_interference "Catcher's interference"), or a
[walk](/wiki/Base_on_balls "Base on balls") or [hit by
pitch](/wiki/Hit_by_pitch "Hit by pitch") with the [bases
loaded](/wiki/Bases_loaded "Bases loaded").[1] A batter is also awarded an RBI
for scoring himself upon hitting a [home run](/wiki/Home_run "Home run").[1]
Sixteen players have batted in at least 10 runs in a single [Major League
Baseball](/wiki/Major_League_Baseball "Major League Baseball") (MLB) game to
date, the most recent being [Mark Reynolds](/wiki/Mark_Reynolds_\(baseball\)
"Mark Reynolds \(baseball\)") of the [Washington
Nationals](/wiki/Washington_Nationals "Washington Nationals") on July 6,
2018.[2] No player has accomplished the feat more than once in his career and
no player has ever recorded more than 12 RBIs in a game. [Wilbert
Robinson](/wiki/Wilbert_Robinson "Wilbert Robinson") was the first player to
record at least 10 RBIs in a single game,[3][4] driving in 11 runs for the
[Baltimore Orioles](/wiki/Baltimore_Orioles_\(19th_century\) "Baltimore
Orioles \(19th century\)") against the [St. Louis
Browns](/wiki/St._Louis_Cardinals "St. Louis Cardinals") on June 10, 1892.[5]

As of
2016[[update]](//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_Major_League_Baseball_single-
game_runs_batted_in_leaders&action=edit), every team that has had a player
achieve the milestone has won the game in which it occurred. These games have
resulted in other single-game MLB records being set due to the stellar
offensive performance. Robinson, for example, also amassed seven hits in that
same game, setting a new major league record that has since been tied by only
one other player.[6] [Mark Whiten](/wiki/Mark_Whiten "Mark Whiten") hit [four
home
runs](/wiki/List_of_Major_League_Baseball_hitters_with_four_home_runs_in_one_game
"List of Major League Baseball hitters with four home runs in one game") to
complement his 12 RBIs for the [St. Louis Cardinals](/wiki/St._Louis_Cardinals
"St. Louis Cardinals") on September 7, 1993, tying the single-game records in
both categories.[7][8] By attaining both milestones, he became one of only two
players to hit four home runs and drive in 10 or more runs in the same
game,[3] with [Scooter Gennett](/wiki/Scooter_Gennett "Scooter Gennett") being
the other.[2][9] [Tony Lazzeri](/wiki/Tony_Lazzeri "Tony Lazzeri"), [Rudy
York](/wiki/Rudy_York "Rudy York"), and [Nomar
Garciaparra](/wiki/Nomar_Garciaparra "Nomar Garciaparra") hit two [grand
slams](/wiki/Grand_slam_\(baseball\) "Grand slam \(baseball\)") during their
10 RBI game,[10][11][12] equaling the record for [most grand slams in one
game](/wiki/List_of_Major_League_Baseball_hitters_with_two_grand_slams_in_one_game
"List of Major League Baseball hitters with two grand slams in one game").[13]
[Norm Zauchin](/wiki/Norm_Zauchin "Norm Zauchin") has the fewest career RBIs
among players who have 10 RBIs in one game with 159, while [Alex
Rodriguez](/wiki/Alex_Rodriguez "Alex Rodriguez"), with 2,086, drove in more
runs than any other player in this group and hit the third most in major
league history.[14]

Of the eight players eligible for the [Baseball Hall of
Fame](/wiki/National_Baseball_Hall_of_Fame_and_Museum "National Baseball Hall
of Fame and Museum") who have batted in 10 runs in a game, four [have been
elected](/wiki/List_of_members_of_the_Baseball_Hall_of_Fame "List of members
of the Baseball Hall of Fame") and one was elected on the first ballot.
Players are eligible for the Hall of Fame if they have played in at least 10
MLB seasons, and have either been retired for five seasons or deceased for at
least six months.[15] These requirements leave three players ineligible who
are living and have played in the past five seasons and two—[Phil
Weintraub](/wiki/Phil_Weintraub "Phil Weintraub") and Zauchin—who did not play
in 10 seasons.[16][17]

## Players[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_Major_League_Baseball_single-

[![A man, wearing a baseball cap with a "B" in the center and a white baseball

logo on the left breast, looks forward
smiling.](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b5/Wilbert_Robinson_1916.jpg/220px-
Wilbert_Robinson_1916.jpg)](/wiki/File:Wilbert_Robinson_1916.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Wilbert_Robinson_1916.jpg "Enlarge")

[Wilbert Robinson](/wiki/Wilbert_Robinson "Wilbert Robinson") was the first
player to drive in at least 10 runs in one game, and also amassed a record
seven hits in the same game.

[Mark Reynolds](/wiki/Mark_Reynolds_\(baseball\) "Mark Reynolds \(baseball\)")
is the most recent player to record 10 RBIs in one game, achieving the feat in
2018.]]
